title: Launch CaDrA Shiny with Compose
text: Docker version >= 20.10, Git version >= 2.21 Docker-compose version >= 1.29 Don’t Docker installed, see Docker Engine Don’t Git installed, see Git Guides

what: (2) CD to CaDrA.shiny folder where docker-compose.yml is stored and edit the yaml file to link the data inputs and code base to appropriate containers
title: Launch CaDrA Shiny with Compose
text: Mount code base CaDrA-shiny /CaDrA-shiny directory inside container (e.g. change /path//CaDrA.shiny CaDrA-shiny directory) Mount shiny bash file /usr/bin/shiny-server.sh directory inside container launch shiny app (e.g. change /path//shiny-server.sh CaDrA-shiny/inst/shinyapp/shiny-server.sh directory) Mount plumber bash file /usr/bin/shiny-server.sh directory inside container launch plumber api (e.g. change /path//shiny-server.sh CaDrA-shiny/inst/plumber/shiny-server.sh directory)
code: version: '3.9'  x-cadra-git-repo:   &cadra-git-repo   https://raw.githubusercontent.com/montilab/CaDrA/devel/inst/docker/Dockerfile  x-cadra-shiny-git-repo:   &cadra-shiny-git-repo   https://github.com/montilab/CaDrA.shiny.git#main    x-cadra-shiny-code:   &cadra-shiny-code   type: bind   source: /path/to/CaDrA.shiny   target: /CaDrA-shiny  x-cadra-shiny-server:   &cadra-shiny-server   type: bind   source: /path/to/CaDrA.shiny/inst/shinyapp/shiny-server.sh   target: /usr/bin/shiny-server.sh     x-cadra-api-server:   &cadra-api-server   type: bind   source: /path/to/CaDrA.shiny/inst/plumber/shiny-server.sh   target: /usr/bin/shiny-server.sh

what: (3) Start all services listed in the docker-compose.yml file
title: Launch CaDrA Shiny with Compose
text: -d: run containers detached mode information docker-compose syntax, see docker-compose reference

what: (4) To check if the services are started sucessfully
title: Launch CaDrA Shiny with Compose

what: (5) Access CaDrA shiny dashboard on the host network
title: Launch CaDrA Shiny with Compose
text: can visit local host using preferred web browser, type http://localhost:4567, check dashboard indeed hosted .

title: Containerizing CaDrA.shiny with Docker
text: Docker version >= 20.10 Git version >= 2.21 Don’t Docker installed, see Docker Engine Don’t Git installed, see Git Guides

title: Containerizing CaDrA.shiny with Docker
text: montiab/cadra:2.0.0 (stored Docker Hub)

what: (2) CD to CaDrA.shiny folder where Dockerfile file is stored and build the Docker image.
title: Containerizing CaDrA.shiny with Docker
text: -t: add tag image version application, e.g. cadra-shiny:1.0.0 cadra-shiny:latest. NOTE: image takes approximately < 10 mins build

what: (3) After the build is completed, you can check if the image is built successfully
title: Containerizing CaDrA.shiny with Docker
code: docker images  REPOSITORY        TAG        IMAGE ID        CREATED        SIZE cadra.shiny       1.0.0      2c22887402d3    2 hours ago    2.56GB

what: (4) To run the container with the built image
title: Containerizing CaDrA.shiny with Docker
text: NOTE: Change /path//CaDrA.shiny local CaDrA.shiny directory. directory must contain code base needed build CaDrA.shiny dashboard. Change /path//CaDrA.shiny/inst/shinyapp/shiny-server.sh local CaDrA.shiny/inst/shinyapp/shiny-server.sh directory. directory contains bash file used launch CaDrA.shiny dashboard. -v: mount code base data files host directory container directory [host_div]:[container_dir]. -p: map host port container port [host_port]:[container_port] --name: give identity container -d: run container detached mode information Docker syntax, see Docker run reference

what: (5) To check if the container is built sucessfully
title: Containerizing CaDrA.shiny with Docker
text: NOTE: cadra-shiny container published port 4567 host machine, 3838 port cadra-shiny published inside container. requests made host redirected Docker container.
code: docker container ps   CONTAINER ID   IMAGE               COMMAND                    CREATED        STATUS        PORTS                    NAMES b37b6b19c4e8   cadra-shiny:1.0.0   "bash dashboard-kickoff"   5 hours ago    Up 5 hours    0.0.0.0:4567->3838/tcp   cadra-shiny

what: (6) Access CaDrA Shiny dashboard on the host network
title: Containerizing CaDrA.shiny with Docker
text: can visit local host using preferred web browser, type http://localhost:4567, check dashboard indeed hosted .

code: @Manual{,   title = {CaDrA.shiny: Shiny Interface for CaDrA},   author = {Reina Chau and Katia Bulekova and Vinay Kartha and Stefano Monti},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://github.com/montilab/CaDrA.shiny/}, }

title: Shiny Interface for CaDrA
text: R Shiny Dashboard Interacting CaDrA package

title: Shiny Interface for CaDrA
text: CaDrA-shiny interactive Shiny dashboard developed allow users directly interacting CaDrA package. CaDrA R package supports heuristic search framework aimed identifying candidate drivers molecular phenotype interest (visit Github repo details). CaDrA shiny dashboard two distinctive features: Run CaDrA search candidate drivers molecular phenotype interest Run GSVA obtain relative enrichment scores given gene sets, subsequently, scores used run CaDrA identify complementary features likely driving input molecular phenotype. Data visualization includes: Meta-feature plot KS enrichment plot Top N candidates overlapping heatmap Permutation-based testing plot CaDrA.shiny package containerized using Docker can deployed Cloud-based services. Docker Image: montilab/cadra-shiny

what: Run CaDrA Shiny App on RStudio Desktop
title: Shiny Interface for CaDrA
text: Don’t RStudio Desktop installed, download .

what: (3) Launch CaDrA Shiny App with dataset included in the package
title: Shiny Interface for CaDrA

what: (4) Launch CaDrA Shiny App with your provided dataset
title: Shiny Interface for CaDrA
code: # Read in your data file. Assume your datafile is stored as csv format mydatafile <- read.csv('/path/to/mydatafile.csv', header=TRUE)  # Lauch CaDrA Shiny app with your provided data file CaDrA.shiny::CaDrA_App(id="myapp", datalist_file=mydatafile)

title: Shiny Interface for CaDrA
text: See User Guide complete documention CaDrA.shiny’s features. get help CaDrA CaDrA.shiny, please use Github dicussion Github issues.

title: Version 1.0
text: Published https://github.com/montilab/CaDrA.shiny/ Documentation: https://montilab.github.io/CaDrA.shiny/ Web Interface: https://cadra.bu.edu/ Relative links: * CaDrA Repo: https://github.com/montilab/CaDrA/ * CaDrA Documentation: https://montilab.github.io/CaDrA/

what: Run both Shiny UI and Server Modules — CaDrA_App
title: Run both Shiny UI and Server Modules — CaDrA_App
text: Run Shiny UI Server Modules

title: Run both Shiny UI and Server Modules — CaDrA_App
Run both Shiny UI and Server Modules — CaDrA_App
text: id unique namespace identifier datalist_file path data file (cvs rds format) listing  absolute paths necessary files start app. datalist_file must contains following variables: 'feature_set' (required), 'feature_set_paths' (repuired),  'input_score_names' (required), input_score_paths' (required),  'gene_expression_names' (optional), 'gene_expression_paths' (optional) Default NULL. NULL, app start DEFAULT dataset included  CaDrA package.

title: Run both Shiny UI and Server Modules — CaDrA_App
text: Shiny application

title: Run both Shiny UI and Server Modules — CaDrA_App
code: # Load R library library(shiny)  id = "myapp"  # Create a Shiny app app <- CaDrA-shiny::CaDrA_App(id = id) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'CaDrA' not found  # Launch and deploy Shiny app (NOT RUN) # shiny::runApp(app, host='0.0.0.0', port=3838)

title: Shiny Server modules — CaDrA_Server
text: Shiny server elements

title: Shiny Server modules — CaDrA_Server
code: # Load R library library(shiny)  # Create ui and server for Shiny app id <- "myapp"  ui <- shiny::fluidPage(    CaDrA-shiny::CaDrA_UI(id = id) ) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'CaDrA' not found  server <- function(input, output, session) {    CaDrA-shiny::CaDrA_Server(id = id) }  app <-  shiny::shinyApp(ui=ui, server=server) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'ui' not found  # Launch and deploy Shiny app (NOT RUN) # shiny::runApp(app, host='0.0.0.0', port=3838)

code: # Load R library library(shiny)  # Create ui and server for Shiny app id <- "myapp"  ui <- shiny::fluidPage(    CaDrA-shiny::CaDrA_UI(id = id) ) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'CaDrA' not found  server <- function(input, output, session) {    CaDrA-shiny::CaDrA_Server(id = id) }  app <- shiny::shinyApp(ui=ui, server=server) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'ui' not found  # Launch Shiny app (NOT RUN) # shiny::runApp(app, host='0.0.0.0', port=3838)
